News

Easter holiday events at Suffolk Libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Mar 29, 2019

Are you looking for something to do during the Easter holidays? We've got loads of children's events happening across our libraries.

Changes to overdue charges for books

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 29, 2019

Suffolk Libraries will be changing charges for overdue books as of 1 April 2019.

Suffolk Libraries to launch first ever Children's Month

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 28, 2019

This April will be the first ever Suffolk Libraries Children’s Month – a brand new campaign to encourage more children and families to use their local library.

Suffolk Libraries receives donation of books on cancer

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 11, 2019

A new collection of library books are now available from Suffolk Libraries following a donation in memory of a local woman who died of cancer.

Take part in OverDrive's Big Library Read for April 2019

Written by Alice Violett · Published Mar 11, 2019

From 1 - 15 April, you can borrow Homes: a refugee story by Abu Bakr al Rabeeah & Winnie Yeung on OverDrive without a wait list and join in a worldwide discussion.

Skulduggery in Stowmarket: Suffolk's newest crime writers' festival returns for a second year

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 6, 2019

This year's Skulduggery in Stowmarket will take place at the library over four days from 26 - 29 April.

Can you help Suffolk Libraries by sharing your story?

Written by James Powell · Published Mar 6, 2019

We’re looking for people who love their library and are prepared to tell us about their experience of using our services.

Long Melford residents to benefit from increased opening hours and library refurbishment

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Feb 28, 2019

Long Melford Library will be closed for refurbishment from 25 March - 1 April. It will reopen on Tuesday 2 April with increased opening hours.

Activities at Ipswich libraries

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 8, 2019

Our seven libraries in the Ipswich area - Broomhill, Chantry, Gainsborough, Ipswich, Kesgrave, Rosehill and Stoke - run several regular activities for children of various ages.

Suffolk Libraries mental health project shortlisted for libraries award

Written by James Powell · Published Feb 6, 2019

A pioneering mental health project run in seven Suffolk Libraries has been shortlisted for an EDGE Libraries Conference award.
